articles.headline: With Bold Steps, Fed Chief Quiets Some Criticism
articles.snippet: After rewriting the rulebook at the Federal Reserve, Ben S. Bernanke appears to have quieted many of his critics.
articles.abstract: After rewriting the rulebook at the Federal Reserve, Ben S. Bernanke appears to have quieted many of his critics.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Over a frantic weekend in mid-March, Ben S. Bernanke rewrote the rule book as chairman of the Federal Reserve. Like a military commander applying overwhelming force, he took steps then and over the next two months that some at the central bank are now calling the Bernanke Doctrine.

articles.headline: Parents’ Grief Turns to Rage at Chinese Officials
articles.snippet: Protests by grieving parents are forcing Chinese officials to address a growing political backlash over shoddy construction of public schools.
articles.abstract: Protests by grieving parents are forcing Chinese officials to address a growing political backlash over shoddy construction of public schools.
articles.lead_paragraph: DUJIANGYAN, China  Bereaved parents whose children were crushed to death in their classrooms during the earthquake in Sichuan Province have turned mourning ceremonies into protests in recent days, forcing officials to address growing political repercussions over shoddy construction of public schools.

articles.headline: Realtors Agree to Stop Blocking Web Listings
articles.snippet: The deal frees Internet brokers and other real-estate agents offering heavily discounted commissions to operate on a level playing field with traditional brokers.
articles.abstract: The deal frees Internet brokers and other real-estate agents offering heavily discounted commissions to operate on a level playing field with traditional brokers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department and the National Association of Realtors reached a major antitrust settlement Tuesday that government officials said should spur competition among brokers and ultimately bring down hefty sales commissions.

articles.headline: The Guessing Game Has Begun on the Next iPhone
articles.snippet: Apple faces a new challenge as it prepares to introduce an updated version of the phone next month.
articles.abstract: Apple faces a new challenge as it prepares to introduce an updated version of the phone next month.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Can Steven P. Jobs top the iPhone ... with another iPhone?

articles.headline: McCain Urges New Arms Pact With Moscow
articles.snippet: Distancing himself from the Bush administration, Senator John McCain vowed to work more closely with Russia.
articles.abstract: Distancing himself from the Bush administration, Senator John McCain vowed to work more closely with Russia.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER  Senator John McCain distanced himself from the Bush administration on Tuesday by vowing to work more closely with Russia on nuclear disarmament and to move toward the elimination of tactical nuclear weapons in Europe.

articles.headline: In Housing, the Strong Turn Weak
articles.snippet: The home-buying season is shaping up to be even worse than expected, with prices falling, sales slowing and few signs of a turnaround.
articles.abstract: The home-buying season is shaping up to be even worse than expected, with prices falling, sales slowing and few signs of a turnaround.
articles.lead_paragraph: America’s home-buying season, when for-sale signs sprout like dandelions, is shaping up to be even worse than expected this year, with prices falling, sales slowing and few signs of a turnaround emerging.

articles.headline: After Failed Deal, Impasse for United and US Air
articles.snippet: Talks between United and US Airways appear to have fallen apart, the second time in a month that United failed to reach a deal with a rival airline.
articles.abstract: Talks between United and US Airways appear to have fallen apart, the second time in a month that United failed to reach a deal with a rival airline.
articles.lead_paragraph: Talks between United Airlines and US Airways appear to have fallen apart, marking the second time in a month that United failed to reach a deal with a rival airline and putting the future of industry consolidation in question, people with knowledge of the discussions said Tuesday night.
articles.byline: By Micheline Maynard and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: As Home Prices Drop Low Enough, a Committed Renter Decides to Buy
articles.snippet: As housing prices slowly come back to reality, buying has again started to make sense for more people.
articles.abstract: As housing prices slowly come back to reality, buying has again started to make sense for more people.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the last few years, I have been an evangelist for renting.
